intro: Monnina fosbergii, commonly known as Fosberg's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
